snippet.textDisplay: Download the SoundAssistant app (You might need the Good Lock app to do so), once installed open it and turn on the "Volume Panel Theme" which should be the second option on the top of the screen, finally set the volume panel theme to the "Sero". It will give you a cleaner volume control like the one Google introduced in Android 9, or the one Apple introduced on ios 13.
snippet.textOriginal: Download the SoundAssistant app (You might need the Good Lock app to do so), once installed open it and turn on the "Volume Panel Theme" which should be the second option on the top of the screen, finally set the volume panel theme to the "Sero". It will give you a cleaner volume control like the one Google introduced in Android 9, or the one Apple introduced on ios 13.

snippet.textDisplay:
If you want to use your phone with only one hand, you can. Just turn on the One Handed Mode.

To do this, Go to Settings > Advanced Features > Scroll down until you find One Handed Mode. Toggle it on then you're all set.

Side note: If you're using the Android 10 gestures, then you can use the One Handed Mode by swiping down in the center of the bottom edge of the screen. If you're still using the conventional navigation buttons, then simply double tap the home button.
snippet.textOriginal:
If you want to use your phone with only one hand, you can. Just turn on the One Handed Mode. 

To do this, Go to Settings > Advanced Features > Scroll down until you find One Handed Mode. Toggle it on then you're all set. 

Side note: If you're using the Android 10 gestures, then you can use the One Handed Mode by swiping down in the center of the bottom edge of the screen. If you're still using the conventional navigation buttons, then simply double tap the home button.

snippet.textDisplay:
If you want to use Dark mode on apps that don't support it, you can turn on Force Dark Mode. Make sure you enabled Developer options for this though.

To enable Developer options, go to Settings > About Phone > Software Information > and then just click the Build Number repeatedly until the Developer Option is on.

Now for the Force Dark Mode. Go to Settings > Developer Options > scroll down until you find Hardware Accelerated Rendering. In that part, you should find the Force Dark Mode option. Toggle it on, and you're all set.
snippet.textOriginal:
If you want to use Dark mode on apps that don't support it, you can turn on Force Dark Mode. Make sure you enabled Developer options for this though. 

To enable Developer options, go to Settings > About Phone > Software Information > and then just click the Build Number repeatedly until the Developer Option is on. 

Now for the Force Dark Mode. Go to Settings > Developer Options > scroll down until you find Hardware Accelerated Rendering. In that part, you should find the Force Dark Mode option. Toggle it on, and you're all set.

snippet.textDisplay: Well, you can use nova launcher and good lock app to enable google like gesture navigation like swipe from edges. Works like a charm, you don't have to be stuck with samsung launcher because you wanna use gesture navigation. You can also swipe down your notification panel with this feature ON ANY SCREEN. Because default samsung swipe down gesture for notification panel won't work while you are on apps or other screens than home screen. My setup is swipe inwards from edges is go back, swipe inwards+down from edges to bring down the notification panel. Good lock also offers neat features like hide icons from status bar like you can hide your wifi, data, provider, etc. icons, switch the clock from left to right we it used to be before Android 10 or 9 not sure.  Use good lock, it is amazing
snippet.textOriginal: Well, you can use nova launcher and good lock app to enable google like gesture navigation like swipe from edges. Works like a charm, you don't have to be stuck with samsung launcher because you wanna use gesture navigation. You can also swipe down your notification panel with this feature ON ANY SCREEN. Because default samsung swipe down gesture for notification panel won't work while you are on apps or other screens than home screen. My setup is swipe inwards from edges is go back, swipe inwards+down from edges to bring down the notification panel. Good lock also offers neat features like hide icons from status bar like you can hide your wifi, data, provider, etc. icons, switch the clock from left to right we it used to be before Android 10 or 9 not sure.  Use good lock, it is amazing

snippet.textDisplay:
1. easy screen turn on
2. sound quality and effects to boost bass of audio from your phone. If possible download Samsung music. Make sure to turn on video enhancer to boost your video content.
3. separate app sound. You can play a sound from a current app with your phone's speakers and leave your music playing with your connected bluetooth devices .
4. I answer calls with my volume up key and end them with the power button on my Galaxy. Even if you won't use it..just enable it, there are situations your screen is dead but the phone is not and you still have to answer calls. You can have caller names read aloud in default call settings in phone app.
5. Since people ask for my phone to do one thing and end up doing the opposite, you can pin apps which will require your password to the home screen.
6. Samsung pass to auto fills websites.
snippet.textOriginal:
1. easy screen turn on
2. sound quality and effects to boost bass of audio from your phone. If possible download Samsung music. Make sure to turn on video enhancer to boost your video content.
3. separate app sound. You can play a sound from a current app with your phone's speakers and leave your music playing with your connected bluetooth devices .
4. I answer calls with my volume up key and end them with the power button on my Galaxy.  Even if you won't use it..just enable it, there are situations your screen is dead but the phone is not and you still have to answer calls. You can have caller names read aloud in default call settings in phone app.
5. Since people ask for my phone to do one thing and end up doing the opposite, you can pin apps which will require your password to the home screen.
6. Samsung pass to auto fills websites.

snippet.textDisplay: Changing what the volume keys control is something I wish Google would add. Stock Android used to have the volume buttons control ringer volume when no media was playing. A few years ago Google changed that to always control media volume (even when nothing is playing). I hate that.
snippet.textOriginal: Changing what the volume keys control is something I wish Google would add. Stock Android used to have the volume buttons control ringer volume when no media was playing. A few years ago Google changed that to always control media volume (even when nothing is playing). I hate that.
